subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: My initial feeling is toward number 3. QS is admittedly not a true phonetic alphabet and already has two mergers, the stressed-unstressed pairs Schwa and the
messageBody:
My initial feeling is toward number 3.

QS is admittedly not a true phonetic alphabet and
already has two mergers, the stressed-unstressed pairs
Schwa and the other one. <Can't find my reference just
now . . .>

As one who merges all three of the 'problem'
letters, I lack knowledge to answer one important
question:
How strongly phonemic for how many people is the
Awe/Ox distinction?

--- Anthony Grahn <othermale@...> wrote:
> Some choices, in reverse order of outrageousness:
> 1. re-examine the way lexical sets are assigned.
> 2. give up on an alphabetical ordering that puts all
> word of all accents together.
> 3. get rid of a letter (presumably merging Awe and
> Ox)

===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein
